title: A Cyberpunk Themed Website
description: Inspired by the game Cyberpunk 2077 by CD Projekt Red, I designed a fictional website for tourists interested in exploring Night City and its various districts, offering a unique digital experience to plan their visit.

title:
Yahtzee Online Game
Using Laravel
description: In a bid to quickly learn a new framework, Laravel, I developed an online Yahtzee game. Leveraging my skills in PHP and HTML, the project's goal was to enable players to enjoy Yahtzee with friends in a turn-based multiplayer setup.

title:
Metroid-Vania Game
Using JavaScript
description: As an avid gamer, I set out to create a Metroidvania-style game using only HTML and JavaScript, challenging my proficiency in these languages. The project also included learning pixel art creation with Aseprite and practicing version control.

title:
Dreamride
Using HTML,Vue.js and PHP
description: My first group project at Educom, Dreamride, was a creative platform for children to write and share stories. I was responsible for developing the database and backend, using Vue.js for dynamic user interactions.

title:
Keep Calm and Gym On Website
Using C#
description: A university group project, this website was a practical application of our learning in planning principles. I led the development, utilizing MVC principles to effectively separate the Views from the Controllers and Models.

title:
First Person Shooter Wolfenstein Style
Using Python
description: In my exploration of game mechanics, I discovered an instructional YouTube video detailing the creation of a Wolfenstein-style first-person shooter in Python. Inspired by this, I aim to enhance my project by adding additional levels, items, and standard game mechanics, further developing my skills in game development.
